kill

public void kill()
Closes all I/O streams then socket. Does not check if sent bytes have been received.

writeObject

public boolean writeObject(java.lang.Object o)
                    throws ConnectionLostException
Write object to socket. Handles socket exceptions by closing socket. After exception this network socket cannot be used for communication.

Parameters:
o - the o
Returns:
true, if successful
Throws:
ConnectionLostException - the connection lost exception

writeInt

                 throws ConnectionLostException

Parameters:

Returns:
true, if successful
Throws:
ConnectionLostException - the connection lost exception

readObject

public java.lang.Object readObject(boolean blocking)
                            throws ConnectionLostException
Reads an object from the socket. If nothing is in the buffer and the read is not blocking then null is returned.

Parameters:
blocking - defines if the read should be blocking or not.
Returns:
the object, null if not blocking and nothing received.
Throws:
ConnectionLostException - the connection lost exception

readObject

public java.lang.Object readObject(int timeout)
                            throws ConnectionLostException
Reads an object from the socket. If something has been received then the object is returned immediately. If nothing is found then this thread will will sleep for timeout milliseconds then return a non-blocking read.

Parameters:
timeout - the milliseconds to wait if nothing received.
Returns:
the object, null if time expired and nothing received.
Throws:
ConnectionLostException - the connection lost exception

readInt

public java.lang.Integer readInt(boolean blocking)
                          throws ConnectionLostException
Reads an Integer from the socket. If nothing is in the buffer and the read is not blocking then null is returned.

Parameters:
blocking - the blocking
Returns:
the Integer, null if time expired and nothing received.
Throws:
ConnectionLostException - the connection lost exception
